info.name: Menu and SearchBar  Minimal Height (DM*)
info.description:
The idea here is to use minimum real estate used for the Menu Toolbar, and other toolbars, so that you have more screen space to use your browser for it's intended purpose of looking at web pages not space hogging graphics.    

This is one of several styles to minimize size of toolbars, look for other styles under my name, David McRitchie, that include "Minimal" in their style names. Currently there is some overlap in toolbars, since I've not learned how to reduce the size of the selection bubbles to be within the toolbars height, but it is quite usable.
info.additionalInfo:
I include the search bar to the right of the menu bar, so that both the location bar and the search bar have more working space.  Use customize to move search box up to menu bar.

This style only affects the menu bar see other styles for the other toolbars.

Right click on a picture,  then view image to see it as a full size image.

The biggest  chuck of wasted space is recovered from the Navigation/Location bar using either
style 9349 (9349)  or style 10881 (10881).

For best viewing of the Before and After pictures install my style 12373 (12373), so you will  be viewing actual sizes if your window is at least 800px wide.   The actual images are  707px x 152px  and 710px x 90px as seen in properties so the reduction in height is about 40% with the menu bar changes along with my other minimal styles. 

Notes:  The  "Launchy" toolbar button has since been fixed in Style 13115 (13115).

All of the style effects show in the After screenshot are from:
* style 9514 (9514)
* style 9350 (9350, this page)
* style 9349 (9349)
* style 13115(13115, if pictures get updated)
* style 9091 (9091)
* style 9043 (9043)
